seniority_level.evidence: Title is 'Data Engineer' without senior/staff designation; responsibilities suggest mid-level work (implementing pipelines, collaborating with teams) without leadership or architecture ownership; no years experience specified

job_family.evidence: Job title explicitly states 'Data Engineer'; core responsibilities focus on ETL, data pipelines, and data storage systems

sub_specialty.evidence: Explicitly mentions ETL tools (DataStage), batch processing, and Snowflake (warehouse); 'both batch and real-time' is mentioned but ETL/batch is emphasized with specific tools

leadership_expectation.evidence: No mention of managing teams, mentoring, or architectural leadership; responsibilities focus on implementation and collaboration, not direction or people management

primary_cloud.evidence: Mentions Hadoop, Spark, DataStage — tools commonly used in on-prem or hybrid environments; no explicit cloud providers (AWS/Azure/GCP) mentioned; Snowflake is cloud but often used in hybrid/on-prem contexts in enterprise

secondary_clouds.evidence: No other cloud platforms mentioned in skills or responsibilities

processing_paradigm.evidence: Explicitly states 'both batch and real-time processing' in responsibilities; tools like Spark and Hadoop support both paradigms

orchestrator_category.evidence: No orchestrator explicitly mentioned; however, ETL/DataStage implies traditional workflow orchestration; Airflow is common in IBM environments but not stated — inferred from industry context

storage_layer.evidence: Snowflake (warehouse) and Hadoop/Spark (lake) mentioned; implies both structured warehouse and raw data lake storage patterns are in use

remote_restriction.evidence: Location specified as 'Kochi, Kerala, India'; work model is 'onsite' — implies must be physically present in that region

timezone_focus.evidence: Location restricted to India (Kochi, Kerala); no mention of global or multi-timezone teams

relocation_required.evidence: Onsite work model + specific location (Kochi, Kerala) implies relocation may be required if not already resident

h1b_friendly.evidence: Location is India; no mention of visa sponsorship; IBM India typically hires locally

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: Location in India; OPT/CPT are US-specific visas; no mention of student visa support

citizenship_required.evidence: Location in India implies local work authorization required; no citizenship requirement stated; 'must_be_resident' in Pass 1 suggests local authorization

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Employment type is 'full_time' and 'permanent' — standard for W2 employment in India; no mention of contract or 1099

benefits_level.evidence: No benefits listed in Pass 1 extraction; no mention of equity, PTO, learning budget, or other perks

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'growth opportunities' implicitly through 'delivering innovation' and 'collaborating with diverse teams' but no explicit career tracks or promotion paths

mentorship_signals.evidence: Mentions 'collaborating with diverse teams including scientists, engineers, consultants and database administrators' — implies learning from experienced colleagues, but no formal mentorship program stated

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of promotions, advancement, or career progression in job description or Pass 1

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal transfers, lateral moves, or exploring other roles within IBM

career_tracks_available.evidence: No mention of IC, management, or specialist tracks; inferred from IBM's general structure but not stated in job posting

requirement_strictness.evidence: Clear 'must have' skills listed (DBT, ETL, DataStage, Snowflake, Java, Python, etc.) with no 'nice to have' — suggests moderate strictness; no 'preferred' or 'bonus' skills soften it slightly

scope_definition.evidence: Focused on data engineering tasks: ETL, pipelines, data storage, and processing; no blending with data science or analytics roles despite mentioning models — scope is well-defined

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Skills listed (DBT, ETL, Snowflake, Python, Spark, Hadoop) are reasonable for a mid-level data engineer; no unrealistic combinations or senior-level expectations for junior role
